name: contemporaneity
content:
contemporaneity noun [U]
(MODERNITY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of relating to the present time: This new production of the opera proves again its durability and contemporaneity. The film has an uncomfortable contemporaneity about it.
More examplesFewer examplesThe composer has been admired by modern critics for his contemporaneity.Although her work was written over sixty years ago, it is often startling in its contemporaneity.The author has taken some liberties with the historical facts in an attempt at contemporaneity.

contemporaneity noun [U]
(EXISTING AT THE SAME PERIOD)
the fact of happening or existing at the same period of time: Archaeological experts have expressed doubt about the contemporaneity of the two palaces. Intricately decorated pottery found at these sites has proved their contemporaneity.
More examplesFewer examplesThere is evidence of contemporaneity between the two sets of dinosaur bones.
